sub_title: Marketing & communications consultant for purpose-driven organizations 👩‍💻 | campaign manager | (copy)writer ✍
summary:
I create and implement communication strategies for people and organisations who are in the business of change-making: companies that make the world a better place, such as sustainability agencies, gender data startups, sexual health companies, foundations, and independent (documentary) film-makers. 

Communication is about storytelling and connecting. And connecting to others is pretty much what life is about, if you ask me (whew! We went from communication to life's purpose real quick). On a serious note: marketing is about making sure that the world – the people you are trying to service or sell to – know what you do and why you do it. And it can be really difficult to get that story right when you are the one doing the work. 

That's where I come in. 💁‍♀️

I help impact organizations with their marketing & communications. This could be writing a marketing strategy, running a multimedia campaign from start to finish, or day-to-day social media management. With my tiny team of freelance creatives I can help you with all-round content support.

I love being allowed into the the different "worlds" of my clients. This variety and diversity in my work is why I love communications. I may be creating a communications strategy one day, organizing a conference the next day, and writing a blog post the day after. 

If this speaks to you, feel free to send me a DM or email – whether you are looking for content support or are a freelance creative looking to do project-based work – I'm always open to chatting! 

Email: hi@irisweges.com 📩 
Website: https://irisweges.com/

_____

Other things to know about me: 

I love collaborating with people from different cultural, national and industry backgrounds. I studied social science and gender studies, specializing in ethnicity and sexuality. That basically means I'm trained to analyse power structures (and that I have really cool friends 😉). Diversity and inclusion are important to me. Diverse perspectives and lived experiences also make for the best work.

I believe the future of office work is remote and flexible. I'm a part-time nomad, mostly based between San Francisco and Amsterdam (my home base), but Washington, D.C. and Mexico have also been home in the past few years. (Read about some of my digital nomad adventures on my blog ➡️ https://irisweges.com/).

awards.title: Fellow: The Coaching Fellowship
awards.description: Selected into a global community of impact leaders, recognized for their outstanding potential to lead courageously and demonstrated commitment to changing the planet.

projects.title: RESEARCH | New Media and Migrants' Religious Practices
projects.description: In a transnational project on digital networks and migration I explored the interaction between new media and migrants’ religious practices. I conducted qualitative research (new media content analysis and focus-group interviews) and processed the research results into a paper for publication.

projects.title: RESEARCH | The socio-cultural dimensions of water | Otavalo, Ecuador
projects.description: As part of a development project I was responsible for the qualitative research project on a water system that was to be implemented at an Indigenous community in the north of Ecuador.

profile_positions.location: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
profile_positions.description: I'm leading the communications and knowledge management activities for WePOWER, which is short for the regional South Asia Women in Power Sector Professional Network. WePOWER's objective is to support workforce participation of women in (renewable & sustainable) energy projects and utilities, and promote normative change for women and girls in Science, Technology, Engineering, and Math (STEM) education. WePOWER is a project from the South Asia Region Gender-Energy Facility (SAGE II).
profile_positions.title: Communications and Knowledge Management Specialist-Consultant

profile_positions.description:
Content | Copywriting | B2B | PR | Website | WordPress | Social Media | LinkedIn | Campaign development & execution | Email Marketing | Newsletters

Rebels work on the issues that affect our future, from sustainability, transportation and urban development to healthcare and the social sector. Rebel is a consultancy and investment agency committed to creating positive change.
profile_positions.title: Consultant - Content Manager

profile_positions.description:
Marketing & Communications Consultancy for purpose-driven organizations | visit: irisweges.com
I work with a flexible, remote team of freelance copywriters, graphic designers and social media experts.

ᴄᴏɴᴛᴇɴᴛ ᴡɪᴛʜ ɪᴍᴘᴀᴄᴛ: we help B Corps, social enterprises, and other impact businesses stay visible and relevant, both online and offline. We provide all-round communication & marketing services: from developing an integrated marketing strategy to all-round media campaigns, from website management to day-to-day content development & editing of social media posts, newsletters, and blog posts. Get in touch to set up a (digital) coffee or free consultation.

Clients include:
World Bank – communications for the Social Inclusion (Gender) & Energy team for South Asia.
Rebel – a consultancy and investment agency that does things a little differently (and does it well!)
Platform Jongeren & Werk – an inclusive workplace initiative for youth supported by the Goldschmeding Foundation
Alnour – A Marrakech-based company and association that produces high-end embroidery products while supporting its staff – women with disabilities – with social and health benefits.
Circular – The company based in Antwerp helps develop circular neighborhoods by providing sustainability-as-a-service.
Rikx – digital marketplace for social impact in Rotterdam (and now globally!)
Provincie Groningen / INTIS – ever heard of wireless charging of e-mobility? It's here.
profile_positions.title: Independent Consultant / Owner

profile_positions.description:
Communication Strategy | Content | Copywriting | Website | Social Media | LinkedIn

'Platform Jongeren & Werk' is a Dutch platform for a more inclusive workplace for youth, financed by the Goldschmeding Foundation. It's an incubator-type platform that supports and funds social & impact entrepreneurs and NGOs. Our guiding principle is: young people in the Netherlands, in all their diversity, should be enabled to participate in work education in a way that suits them.
profile_positions.title: Consultant – Communications

profile_positions.company: The Women's Impact Alliance (formerly The Coaching Fellowship)
profile_positions.description: Selected to join The Coaching Fellowship program for young women leaders in social change. As part of The Coaching Fellowship’s women of impact community we are working together to build the new world and a new generation of women leaders.
profile_positions.title: Fellow: The Coaching Fellowship

profile_positions.description:
Content | Copywriting | B2B | Website | WordPress | Social Media | Twitter | LinkedIn | Campaign development & execution | Email Marketing | Newsletters | PR | CRM implementation | HubSpot

Equileap promotes gender-lens investing as a powerful strategy to close the gender gap. They believe that positive economic change for a more equitable world will happen faster if companies become more transparent on how they treat both male and female employees.
profile_positions.title: Consultant / Communications & Operations Associate

profile_positions.description: The Female Health Company (now Veru Inc.) manufactures, markets, and sells the FC2 Female Condom, a female-controlled product that provides dual protection against unintended pregnancy and STIs. As the Communication Manager for Female Health Company I helped build successful reproductive and sexual health programs, policies and campaigns that integrate the FC2 female condom worldwide.
profile_positions.title: Communication Manager

company.name: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam

profile_positions.company: International Institute of Social Studies (ISS) of Erasmus University Rotterdam
profile_positions.description: I assisted Dr. Karen Gabriel for the Marie Curie Action Research Fellowship 'Images of Organized Sex: The Pornography Industry in India and the Netherlands'. The research drew on postcolonial feminist political economy approaches, for which I examined legislation, policies, literature and held interviews.
profile_positions.title: Consultant – Research assistant

profile_positions.description: OneWorld Magazine looks at how people are connected worldwide. It is the largest Dutch website on global connection and sustainability. For OneWorld Love I wrote on love & sexuality.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Writer

company.name: Yarkuwa Indigenous Knowledge Centre Aborginal Corporation

profile_positions.company: Yarkuwa Indigenous Knowledge Centre Aborginal Corporation
profile_positions.description: Combining academic research with fieldwork, I conducted qualitative research (interviewing, focus-groups, and participant-observation) with a local Aboriginal community. The final project report contributed to a land-transferring process back to its traditional owners.
profile_positions.title: Research Assistant

volunteer_experiences.description: As an editor for online magazine Lover I wrote on inequality between men and women, racism and sexism. By interviewing a wide variety of people who are all unique I attempted to show the diversity in stories women have to tell in the Netherlands and beyond.
Head tutor for the summer school in European Women and Gender studies. Coordination, planning and organization of program and support to the international group (30+) of students.
For RAwR: Raising Awareness with Reaction, a project for Aiesec Malaysia, I ran a series of sex education workshops in Kuala-Lumpur’s high-schools, raising awareness about the risks of HIV and AIDS.
